comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: The Pamir had a long and chequered career under 5 flags, including some time in the 1930s on the Australian wheat trade. Launched in 1905, she capsized and sank in a hurricane off Argentina in 1957. See: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pamir_ship , beachcomber link below:

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] For some reason Flickr doesn't like links with brackets. Fixed here - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pamir_(ship)

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for the wikipedia links and for your comments!

comment.author: 42523234@N02
comment._content: My grandfather used to be on a sailing ship called the ss california home port Liverpool I believe, he served in the wavy navy (merchant) and the royal navy finsihing as a commander. We did try and get some back ground on the california but there wwere several ships of this name.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/friston_motors] Hi Friston Motors, if you can provide specific dates that could narrow things down a bit. There were two Anchor Line Ltd steamships called CALIFORNIA. Just to clarify, was it a steamship or a sailing ship? Also, for a list of helpful hints please see our comprehensive research guides on seafaring ancestors.
